arm_group.description: Patients who underwent aortic surgery in Samsung Medical Center during the period between 2004 and 2010

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery has been reported to increase morbidity and
      mortality. Several risk scoring models for prediction of aortic kidney injury after cardiac
      surgery have been developed. However, predictive accuracy of these models is stil unclear.
      The aim of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of four pre-existing prediction models
      using a gray zone approach in patients who underwent aortic surgery in our institution.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of Pre-existing Risk Scoring Models for Predicting Acute Kidney Injury in Patients Who Underwent Aortic Surgery Using a Gray Zone Approach

detailed_description.textblock:
Acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery has been reported to increase morbidity and
      mortality. Several risk scoring models for prediction of aortic kidney injury after cardiac
      surgery have been developed. However, predictive accuracy of these models is stil unclear.
      The aim of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of four pre-existing prediction models
      (AKICS, Wijeysundera, Mehta, and Thakar model)using a gray zone approach in patients who
      underwent aortic surgery in our institution. Based on receiver operating characteristic
      (ROC) curve analysis, we will construct a gray zone using the cut-off values with a
      sensitivity of < 90%, and a specificity of < 90% (diagnostic tolerance of 10%).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Those who underwent elective or emergency aortic surgery in Samsung Medical Center
             during between 2004 and 2010.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  missing laboratory data

          -  preoperative hemodialysis

          -  death during or within 48 hours after surgery

study_pop.textblock:
Those who underwent elective or emergency aortic surgery in Samsung Medical Center during
        between 2004 and 2010.

intervention.intervention_name: elective or emergency aortic surgery (including ascending, arch, descending thoracic aorta)

facility.name: Samsung Medical Center, Sungkyunkwan University, School of Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of Pre-existing Risk Scoring Models for Predicting Acute Kidney Injury in Patients Who Underwent Aortic Surgery Using a Gray Zone Approach

primary_outcome.description:
abrupt (within 48 hours) reduction in kidney function currently defined as
absolute increase in serum creatinine of more than or equal to 0.3 mg/dl (≥ 26.4 μmol/l),
a percentage increase in serum creatinine of more than or equal to 50% (1.5-fold from baseline), or
a reduction in urine output (documented oliguria of less than 0.5 ml/kg per hour for more than six hours)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Thresholds with as a sensitivity of < 90% and a specificity of < 90%.
secondary_outcome.measure: Gray zone range of each risk scoring model

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in the gray zone in each risk scoring model
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients in the gray zone

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
